page.title: 11A TEYNHAM HAULAGE COMPANY
page.content: A & R J Wood are a haulage company on the A2 in Teynham. They have seventeen 38-tonne Mercedes lorries which cost up to Â£40000 each. The business was started in 1949 by Alf and Roy Wood in Sittingbourne but moved to Teynham about 14 years ago. The business grew bigger as Sheerness docks expanded. The brothers now own separate companies. The firm employs a total of about 90 people. At Teynham there are about 22 drivers, 8 or 9 loading men and 23 office staff. The remainder are employed in other offices around the country. The driver's wage is Â£2.41 an hour. They are not allowed to drive more than 8 hours a day. They haul imported fruit and vegetables from Sheerness or Newhaven docks, for example: oranges, lemons, apples, pears and potatoes. 1100 tonnes can be stored at the depot.
